exhibitionname: Van Gogh and the Colors of the Night
Description: Explores Van Gogh's fascination with the night and the stars, showcasing works like 'Starry Night' and 'Wheatfield with Crows.'
This exhibition looks at Van Gogh's relationship with gardens and nature, showcasing works such as 'The Flowering Almond Tree' and 'Garden of the Asylum.'
A unique exhibition combining Van Gogh's art with modern technology, allowing visitors to step into his most iconic paintings through virtual reality.

exhibitionname: The Van Gogh Masterpieces: From Arles to Saint-Rémy
Description: A journey through Van Gogh's time in southern France, featuring masterpieces like 'The Bedroom' and 'The Olive Trees.'
Focuses on Van Gogh's iconic 'Sunflowers' series and his relationship with the symbol of the flower in his work.

exhibitionname: Van Gogh: The Artist and His Influence
Description: An exploration of Van Gogh's artistic journey, looking at how his works influenced future generations of artists.
Examines Van Gogh's admiration for Japanese art and how it influenced his style and works like 'The Bridge in the Rain' and 'The Courtesan.'

exhibitionname: The Legacy of Van Gogh: His Final Works
Description: This exhibition delves into the final years of Van Gogh's life, showcasing his works created during his time in Auvers-sur-Oise and his lasting impact on modern art.
